items.sentence: The reason Tom does that for Mary is because he loves her.
It won't be easy to find a time that works for both of us.
Tom wanted to be able to play the ukulele as well as Mary.
We saw a man with a dog standing near the telephone booth.
I wonder why your dog didn't bark when I came to the door.
Tom didn't give me everything that he promised to give me.
I thought that we'd agreed not to talk about that anymore.
I don't suppose it's possible to read a book by moonlight.
I don't want to be intrusive, but is everything all right?
Mr. Jackson is the teacher who gives us the most homework.
Tom and Mary both have to stay in Australia until October.
I hope Tom isn't going to be the one who does the driving.
There are three students with the same name in that class.
I think Mary will be offended by what Tom is going to say.
Smoking in a car with a child under 16 is against the law.
Which shirt do you like more, the red one or the blue one?
Tom was the one who told me that I didn't have to do that.
I didn't wait for Tom and went to look for Mary by myself.
I think my French pronunciation is much better than Tom's.
French was the only language I spoke until I was thirteen.
